header.#text: Amendments to the Controlled Substances Act

text.#text: by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , a drug or hormonal substance (other than estrogens, progestins, corticosteroids, and dehydroepiandrosterone) that is not listed in
and is derived from, or has a chemical structure substantially similar to, 1 or more anabolic steroids listed in
shall be considered to be an anabolic steroid for purposes of this Act if—

text.#text: the drug or substance has been created or manufactured with the intent of producing a drug or other substance that either—
otherwise causes a pharmacological effect similar to that of testosterone; or

the drug or substance has been, or is intended to be, marketed or otherwise promoted in any manner suggesting that consuming it will promote muscle growth or any other pharmacological effect similar to that of testosterone.
A substance shall not be considered to be a drug or hormonal substance for purposes of this subparagraph if it—
a concentrate, metabolite, or extract of, or a constituent isolated directly from, an herb or other botanical; or

header.#text: Offenses involving false labeling of anabolic steroids

continuation-text.#text: any anabolic steroid, or any product containing an anabolic steroid, that does not bear a label clearly identifying any anabolic steroid contained in such steroid or product by the nomenclature used by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC).

text.#text: to import into the United States or to export from the United States;
to manufacture, distribute, dispense, sell, or offer to sell; or
to possess with intent to manufacture, distribute, dispense, sell, or offer to sell;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: knowing, intending, or having reasonable cause to believe, that the substance or product is an anabolic steroid, or contains an anabolic steroid, shall be sentenced to a term of imprisonment of not more than 10 years, a fine not to exceed the greater of that authorized in accordance with the provisions of
, or $500,000 if the defendant is an individual or $2,500,000 if the defendant is other than an individual, or both.
shall be subject to a civil penalty as follows:

), up to $500,000 per violation. For purposes of this subparagraph, a violation is defined as each instance of importation, exportation, manufacturing, or distribution, and each anabolic steroid or product imported, exported, manufactured, or distributed.

text.#text: In the case of an importer, exporter, manufacturer, or distributor (other than as provided in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or the
shall be considered additional violations.

text.#text: In the case of a sale or offer to sell at retail, up to $25,000 per violation. For purposes of this subparagraph, each sale and each product offered for sale shall be considered a separate violation. Continued offers to sell by a person 10 or more days after written notice (including through electronic message) to the person by the

term.#tail: means a discrete article, either in bulk or in finished form prepared for sale. A number of articles, if similarly packaged and bearing identical labels, shall be considered as one product, but each package size, form, or differently labeled article shall be considered a separate product.

header.#text: Identification and publication of list of products containing anabolic steroids

may publish in the Federal Register or on the website of the
a list of products that he has determined, based on substantial evidence, contain an anabolic steroid and are not labeled in accordance with this section.
shall not constitute evidence that the product does not contain an anabolic steroid.

is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 305 of the Controlled Substances Act

text.#text: It shall be unlawful to import, export, manufacture, distribute, dispense, or possess with intent to manufacture, distribute, or dispense, an anabolic steroid or product containing an anabolic steroid, unless the steroid or product bears a label clearly identifying an anabolic steroid or product containing an anabolic steroid by the nomenclature used by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is exempt from the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry nomenclature requirement of this subsection if such product is labeled in the manner required under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act

text.#text: A product is described in this subparagraph if the product—
